DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Cholesterol Triglycerides Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services related to any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting to find the principal sterol of all higher animals, distributed in body tissues, especially the brain and spinal cord, and in animal fats and oils and the fats composed of three fatty acid chains linked to a glycerol molecule.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Cholesterol Triglycerides Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services related to any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting to find the principal sterol of all higher animals, distributed in body tissues, especially the brain and spinal cord, and in animal fats and oils and the fats composed of three fatty acid chains linked to a glycerol molecule.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The principal sterol of all higher animals, distributed in body tissues, especially the brain and spinal cord, and in animal fats and oils. (MSH98):Fats composed of three fatty acid chains linked to a glycerol molecule.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: An animal sterol found in the body tissues (and blood plasma) of vertebrates. It can be found in large concentrations within the liver, spinal cord, and brain. Cholesterol is an important component of the membranes of cells, providing stability. It is the major precursor for the synthesis of vitamin D, of the various steroid hormones, including cortisol, cortisone, and aldosterone in the adrenal glands, and of the sex hormones progesterone, estrogen, and testosterone.  Cholesterol also has an important role for the brain synapses as well as in the immune system.  In conditions featuring elevated low density lipoproteins (LDL), cholesterol often forms plaque deposits in the walls of arteries, a condition known as atherosclerosis, which is a major contributor to coronary heart disease and other forms of cardiovascular disease.
Fats composed of three fatty acid chains linked to a glycerol molecule.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Is fasting cholesterol less than or equal to 300 mg/dl and fasting triglycerides less than or equal to 300 mg/dl?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have adequate serum triglyceride and cholesterol levels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have grade greater than or equal to 2 uncontrolled or untreated hypercholesterolemia (greater than 300 mg/dL) or hypertriglyceridemia (greater than 300 mg/dL)?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have grade 2 or greater uncontrolled or untreated hypercholesterolemia (greater than 300mg/dL) or hypertriglyceridemia (greater than 300mg/dL)?
